Class KnapsackUnbounded

java.lang.Object

public class KnapsackUnbounded extends Object
various unbounded knapsack problems

  • Method Details

    • maxValueForTarget

      public static int maxValueForTarget(int[] values, int[] weights, int target)
      find maximum value from summing the values associated with an unbounded quantity of weights that sum to exactly EQ target.
      Parameters:
      values - non-negative values for items. values and weights describe the same items.
      weights - non-negative array of weights for items
      target - the exact sum that a combination of an unbounded number of weights should sum to
      Returns:
      the maximum value for items whose weights sum up to exactly equal target.

    • maxValueForCapacity

      public static int maxValueForCapacity(int[] values, int[] weights, int capacity)
      find maximum value from summing the values associated with an unbounded quantity of weights that sum to LEQ to capacity.
      Parameters:
      values - non-negative values for items. values and weights describe the same items.
      weights - non-negative array of weights for items
      capacity - upper limit to the sum of weights for an unbounded number of items
      Returns:

    • maxValue

    • minNumberOfItemsForTarget

      public static int minNumberOfItemsForTarget(int[] weights, int target)
      find the minimum number of items whose weights sum to exactly EQ target.
      Parameters:
      weights - non-negative array of item weights
      target - the exact sum that a combination of and unbounded quantity of weights should sum to
      Returns:

    • minNumberOfItemsForCapacity

      public static int minNumberOfItemsForCapacity(int[] weights, int capacity)
      find the minimum number of items whose weights sum to LEQ capacity.
      Parameters:
      weights - non-negative array of item weights
      capacity - the sum that a combination of and unbounded quantity of weights should sum to if possible, else the min for the greatest lower sum which was met.
      Returns:

    • minNumberOfItems

      public static int minNumberOfItems(int[] weights, int target, boolean solveForExact)

    • minNumberOfItemsForCapacity2

      public static int minNumberOfItemsForCapacity2(int[] weights, int capacity)
      find the minimum number of items whose weights sum to LEQ capacity.
      Parameters:
      weights - non-negative array of item weights
      capacity - the sum that a combination of and unbounded quantity of weights should sum to if possible, else the min for the greatest lower sum which was met.
      Returns:

    • numberOfWaysForTarget

      public static int numberOfWaysForTarget(int[] weights, int target)
      count the number of ways that a combination of an unbounded quantity of weights can sum up to exactly EQ target. The combinations are counted as sets, that is, same numbers in a set are counted only once.
      Parameters:
      target - the exact sum that a combination of and unbounded quantity of weights should sum to
      weights - non-negative array of item weights
      Returns:

    • numberOfSequencesForTarget

      public static int numberOfSequencesForTarget(int[] weights, int target)
      count the number of ways that a combination of an unbounded quantity of weights can sum up to exactly EQ target, where the sequences are counted rather than sets, e.g. [1,2] is counted and [2,1] is counted.
      Parameters:
      target - the exact sum that a combination of and unbounded quantity of weights should sum to
      weights - non-negative array of item weights
      Returns:
